problem_text: ∗8.51. (J. McKay). If G is a finite group and p a prime let mp(G) denote the number of ordinary irreducible characters of G whose degree is not divisible by p. Let P be a Sylow p-subgroup of G. Is it true that mp(G) = mp(NG(P))? J. B. Olsson
answer: Yes, it is true (M. Cabanes, B. Sp¨ath, Preprint, 2024, https://arxiv.org/abs/2410.20392)
